question: The East-West Industrial Corridor road, which was recently in news as it is passing through the Pakke Tiger Reserve, is located in which state?
explanation: The East-West Industrial Corridor road is proposed to connect the foothill districts of Arunachal Pradesh without passing through Assam. The road will pass through the heart of the Pakke Tiger Reserve (PTR) to connect Seijosa in Pakke-Kessang district with Bhalukpong in West Kameng. The 692.70 km long industrial corridor would run along the foothills on the boundaries of Arunachal and Assam.
